alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 5:37PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 PM EDT, the public reported street flooding due to heavy rain in Commercial Boulevard and State Road 7 from thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Central and Northern Broward County are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Lauderhill, Oakland Park, Lauderdale Lakes, Dania Beach, Cooper City, Wilton Manors, Lazy Lake, Melrose Park, Broadview Park, St. George, Chula Vista, Washington Park, Franklin Park and Golden Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.
